column31: Salma Khadra Jayyusi was born on 16 April 1925 in the Jordanian city of al-Salt to a Palestinian father and a Lebanese mother. She studied Arabic and English literature at the American University of Beirut. In her early family life with her spouse Burhan Kamal al-Jayyusi, a diplomate, she moved between many places such as Jerusalem, Rome, Madrid, Baghdad and London with their three children Usama, Lina and May. Jayyusi published her first and only collection of poetry, Returning from the Dreamy Fountain in 1960. In 1970, she was awarded her Ph.D. from the School of Oriental and African Studies at the University of London. Her dissertation, entitled Trends and Movements in Modern Arabic Poetry was published in 1977. Afterwards, she pursued teaching at several universities throughout Sudan, Algeria and the United States. Her two main long-term research projects were the Project of Translation from Arabic (PROTA) from 1980 onwards and East-West-Nexus from 1990 onwards. From both projects resulted numerous edited anthologies of Arabic literature in English translation.

column31: A Palestinian writer who came to Tunis in 1980 and lives there to this day. He is famous for being Darwish´s compagnion with whom he shared a flat in Haifa´s Abbas Street 35 for 5 years. He left Palestine after leaving prison where he had stayed for six years. He breifly stayed in Cairo and Beirut, fled to Germany and then settled in Tunis. His first wife was killed in Beirut.

A valuable literary personality who owns a vast private collection.

Palestinian writer whose folk literature was analysed in an article from the Tunisian journal al-Tariq al-Jadid. He was a member of the communist party in the 1950s, exiled between 1948 and 1967, imprisoned between 1973 and 1974 and received a prize for popular heritage.
